results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..k} (-1)^i * binomial(2*n+1,i) * binomial(k+2-i,2)^n, 0 <= k <= 2*(n-1).
comment: In general, let b(k,e,p) = Sum_{i=0..k} (-1)^i*binomial(e*p+1,i)*binomial(k+e-i,e)^p. Then T(n,k) = b(k,2,n).
With these coefficients we can calculate: Sum_{i=1..n} binomial(i+e-1,e)^p = Sum_{k=0..e*(p-1)} b(k,e,p)*binomial(n+e+k,e*p+k).

T(n,k) is the number of permutations of 2 indistinguishable copies of 1..n with exactly k descents. A descent is a pair of adjacent elements with the second element less than the first. - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 06 2020
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1600 (rows 1..40)
H. Prodinger, On Touchard's continued fraction and extensions: combinatorics-free, self-contained proofs , arXiv:1102.5186 [math.CO], 2011.
formula: T(n,k) = (-1) times coefficient of x^k in (x-1)^(2*n+1) * Sum_{k>=0} (k*(k+1)/2)^n *x^(k-1).
The sequence of alternating row sums (unsigned) [1, 1, 2, 10, 104, 1816,...] appears to be A005799. (End)
example: The T(2,1) = 4 permutations of 1122 with 1 descent are 1212, 1221, 2112, 2211. - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 15 2020
